CatDescriptText: Mrs. Jane Kovash, 2117 Brownsville Road, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 12, 1958, pg. A1 with question: �Do you think that the Pittsburgh Railways Company is justified in asking an increase in trolley fares?� answer reads: �Yes, I think that they are entitled to the increase in trolley fares.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jan Kovash, wearing dark coat with lapels and collar, light colored collared blouse and gloves, and bracelet with heart charm, holding a dark handbag, standing on sidewalk in front of "Janet Bridal Shop" store window displaying mannequin wearing light colored wedding dress and veil, sign inscribed "...Bridal Gowns...Spring and Summer 49.95", store windows and woman in background
